item.title: How do i add a object and make it do things?

item.description:
@LEL wrote:

Tico, I meant when clicking on it :D. Not literaly making it “do things”.

item.title: How do i add a object and make it do things?
item.dc:creator: @hippyss hippyss
item.description:
@hippyss wrote:

[quote=“Tico135, post:5, topic:118523”][quote author=LEL link=topic=167886.msg1560209#msg1560209 date=1183278536]
making it do things, is by using cases.

For training on these it should look like:

case OBJECTID:		
if (actionTimer == 0) {
sendMessage("messagehere"); //not required
stillgfx(336, absY, absX); //fun to look at :D
setAnimation(2995); //what you do when you click the object
addSkillXP((8500*playerLevel[0]), 0); //training skill
actionTimer = 12; //divided by 10 = 1.2 seconds it will work, every.
}
break;

[/quote]

Voids buddy, learn your piece of java. :P[/quote]
Or make a case and put voidhere(); in it o.o And it’s “CUP of java”

Read full topic
item.source: How do i add a object and make it do things?

item.title: How do i add a object and make it do things?
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

To add an object, you must add this in your client.java. I will not tell you where to put it and i hope you will learn something:

[code]
public void makeGlobalObject(int x, int y, int typeID, int orientation, int tileObjectType){ //Makes Global objects
for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players){
if(p != null){
client person = (client)p;
if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != “null”)){
if(person.distanceToPoint(x, y) <= 60){
person.createNewTileObject(x, y, typeID, orientation, tileObjectType);
}
}
}
}
}

public void ReplaceObject2(int objectX, int objectY, int NewObjectID, int Face, int ObjectType) {
outStream.createFrame(85);
outStream.writeByteC(objectY - (mapRegionY * 8));
outStream.writeByteC(objectX - (mapRegionX * 8));

	outStream.createFrame(101);
	outStream.writeByteC((ObjectType<<2) + (Face&3));
	outStream.writeByte(0);

	if (NewObjectID != -1) {
		outStream.createFrame(151);
		outStream.writeByteS(0);
		outStream.writeWordBigEndian(NewObjectID);
		outStream.writeByteS((ObjectType<<2) + (Face&3));
		//FACE: 0= WEST | -1 = NORTH | -2 = EAST | -3 = SOUTH
		//ObjectType: 0-3 wall objects, 4-8 wall decoration, 9: diag. walls, 10-11 world objects, 12-21: roofs, 22: floor decoration
	}
}

public void NewObjects() {[/code]

To make a new object, you must add something like this under:

public void NewObjects() {
makeGlobalObject(2843, 3336, 358, 0, 10);//Crate

This makes a crate in Entrana. To make your own, you must do this:

makeGlobalObject([xcoord], [ycoord], [objectid], [direction], 10);//[objectname]

To make an object do something, you must make a void for it. I will show you my hitdummy void.

[code]public void hitDummy()
{
//if(actionTimer == 30)
//{
if (FightType == 1) // attack

		addSkillXP(25, 0);
		//sendMessage("You hit the Dummy, you gain Attack xp!");
            }
	if (FightType == 2) // strength
	{
		addSkillXP(25, 0);
		//sendMessage("You hit the Dummy, you gain Attack xp!");
	}
	if (FightType == 3) // defence
	{
		addSkillXP(25, 0);
		//sendMessage("You hit the Dummy, you gain Attack xp!");
	}
	if (FightType == 4) // controlled
	{
		addSkillXP(25, 0);
		//sendMessage("You hit the Dummy, you gain Attack xp!");
	}
}[/code]

This is an idea of how you would do it, please try to learn to make it yourself and do not steal mine.

Read full topic
